meaningMnemonic: This isn't exactly the same as the <radical>fins</radical> radical, but it's close. Sometimes this will happen (where we have to use a slightly "modified radical" version of the original), so it's good to understand that now, early on. In this case, we have fins. How many fins? <kanji>Eight</kanji> fins. How do you know that? Because you caught four fish with two fins each.
readingMnemonic: After you count and smell all <kanji>eight</kanji> of your fins, it's time to put them away. You open a large <reading>hatch</reading> (はち) and put them in. This is where you keep your fins, always putting in eight at a time because that's what the boss wants.
